Mar 19, 2020

I’m supposed to be giving a talk this weekend over Zoom about the Riemann-Hilbert correspondence, for the mixed Hodge modules seminar. I have some notes here and slides here. Ah, but now one realizes that this is just the Griffiths transversality condition! (The usual formulation of the Griffiths transversality condition uses a decreasing filtration.)

The upshot is that this notion of a -connection via is exactly imposing the existence of a Hodge filtration. We saw above that the associated graded of is , and so the associated graded of a -connection is precisely a Higgs field. I just learned that all this is part of Simpson et. al.’s story of nonabelian Hodge theory, which sounds terrifying.

Here is an interesting question. Grothendieck told us that . Is there a stack such that ? As -connections are most naturally defined over , we would expect to live over . The fiber over would be the de Rham space , and the fiber over would be (because the associated graded of was ). We will discuss this in the next post.

At this point, there are a lot of interesting questions that one could ask. D-modules on smooth complex varieties show up in a bunch of places, like the Riemann-Hilbert correspondence and the Beilinson-Bernstein theorem in representation theory. What are the deformations of these results to -modules? Are they interesting? Another set of questions that one could ask are in the direction of characteristic phenomena: the appropriate analogue of D-modules in characteristic are F-crystals, so one could ask these questions in that context as well. I’m gonna think about this more.
